etymology.description: 開(開) (kāi, "open") + 瓶(瓶) (píng, "bottle") + 器(器) (qì, "tool") = a tool for opening bottles.
etymology.interpretation: The word 開瓶器(開瓶器) (kāipíngqì, "bottle opener") makes sense because it is a tool specifically designed for the purpose of opening bottles. This straightforward combination of meanings captures the functionality of the object in a direct manner.

examples.chinese: 他拿起开瓶器(他拿起開瓶器)，轻松打开啤酒(輕鬆打開啤酒)。
examples.pinyin: Tā ná qǐ kāipíngqì, qīngsōng dǎkāi píjiǔ.
examples.english: He picked up the bottle opener and easily opened the beer.

examples.chinese: 厨师使用开瓶器(廚師使用開瓶器)，准备晚餐(準備晚餐)。
examples.english: The chef used the bottle opener to prepare dinner.

examples.chinese: 在野餐时(在野餐時)，开瓶器很有用(開瓶器很有用)。
examples.pinyin: Zài yěcān shí, kāipíngqì hěn yǒuyòng.
examples.english: At the picnic, the bottle opener was very useful.
